t: Psalm 106
Praise*p ye the Lord.*s O give thanks unto the Lord;*s for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
Who*p can utter the mighty acts of the Lord?*s who can shew forth all his praise?
Blessed*p are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.
Remember*p me, O Lord,*s with the favour that thou bearest unto thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;
That*p I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.
We*p have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.
Our*p fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked him at the sea, even at the Red sea.
Nevertheless*p he saved them for his name's sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.
He*p rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.
And*p he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
And*p the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.
Then*p believed they his words; they sang his praise.
They*p soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:
But*p lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.
And*p he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.
They*p envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the Lord.*s
The*p earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.
And*p a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.
They*p made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.
Thus*p they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.
They*p forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;
Wondrous*p works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red sea.
Therefore*p he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.
Yea,*p they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:
But*p murmured in their tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of the Lord.*s
Therefore*p he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:
To*p overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.
They*p joined themselves also unto Baalâ€“peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.
Thus*p they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.
Then*p stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and so the plague was stayed.
And*p that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.
They*p angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:
Because*p they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.
They*p did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the Lord*s commanded them:
But*p were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.
And*p they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.
Yea,*p they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,
And*p shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.
Thus*p were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.
Therefore*p was the wrath of the Lord*s kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.
And*p he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.
Their*p enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.
Many*p times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.
Nevertheless*p he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:
And*p he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.
He*p made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.
Save*p us, O Lord*s our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.
Blessed*p be the Lord*s God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the Lord.*s
